comment.author: 77199267@N03
comment._content: This photo was taken before St Patrick's Park was laid out. The road to the right is Patrick's Close North which no longer exists but ran immediately to the north of the Cathedral. The building with the posters on it and much of that side of the street was demolished to make way for the park which was completed in 1902. The decision to create the park was taken in 1887 so these buildings would have had their death warrant signed by the time this photo was taken. Some more info on the history of the creation of the park here (pdf) www.ucd.ie/archaeology/documentstore/hc_reports/lod/St_Pa... I don't see the Iveagh Trust Buildings here either which puts the photo pre-1901
